Name: Literature
meaning: any collection of written works included the written accounts of oral culture artifacts;

Name: Narrative
meaning: any account of a series of related events or experiences,whether nonfictional (memoir, biography, news report, documentary, travelogue, etc.) or fictional (fairy tale, fable, legend, thriller, novel, etc.);
Linguistic root:
Latin: narrare: to tell;
Latin: gnarus: knowing or skilled;

Name: World-view
Children:
Reality; Culture;
Knowledge; Point of view

Name: History
meaning: Study of past events that includes 1) observation of the reality of events, 2) interpretation of their collected facts and data, 3) information processing of the evidences and interpreted information, 4) generating ideas, knowledge, and theories in accordance with reality of past events);
Linguistic root: Greek: historía: knowledge acquired by investigation ;

Name: Document
